meanings.definition: To make a word part of one's vocabulary.
meanings.sent1: She quickly lexicalizes new terms she learns in school.
meanings.sent2: He lexicalizes unfamiliar words by looking them up in the dictionary.
meanings.sent3: The young student lexicalizes words like a language detective.
meanings.sent4: Her mind lexicalizes words effortlessly, like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: Practice is key to effectively lexicalizing new vocabulary.

meanings.definition: To convert into a word or words.
meanings.sent1: The translator lexicalizes the foreign text into English.
meanings.sent2: The software program lexicalizes spoken words into written text.
meanings.sent3: His creativity lexicalizes thoughts into beautiful poetry.
meanings.sent4: The artist lexicalizes emotions into vibrant paintings.
meanings.sent5: Music has the power to lexicalize feelings that words cannot express.
